name: qopilot
description: Q-System infrastructure: Q-semver identity and session discovery tools

languageModelTools.name: qopilot_list_sessions
languageModelTools.userDescription: List all chat sessions in the current workspace
languageModelTools.modelDescription: List all chat sessions stored in VS Code AppData for the current workspace. Returns session IDs, request counts, reboot counts, custom titles, and kairotic Q values. Use to discover existing sessions before attempting inter-session communication.

workspaceHash.description: Optional: specific workspace storage hash. Otherwise uses current workspace.

languageModelTools.name: qopilot_get_session
languageModelTools.userDescription: Get detailed information about a specific chat session
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Get detailed information about a specific chat session by ID. Can optionally include message history summaries. Searches all workspace storage locations.

sessionId.description: The session UUID to look up

languageModelTools.name: qopilot_send_message
languageModelTools.userDescription: Attempt to send a message to another session (file-based only)
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Attempt to send a message to another chat session. WARNING: VS Code does not expose an API for direct message injection. This tool writes to a file-based inbox that the target session must be watching. The target agent must implement inbox polling to receive messages. This is NOT a real-time messaging system.

languageModelTools.name: qopilot_mcp_control
languageModelTools.userDescription: Control MCP servers (start, stop, restart, list)
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Control MCP server lifecycle. Actions: 'list' (show all servers and status), 'start' (start a server by name), 'stop' (stop a server), 'restart' (restart a server), 'start-all' (start all servers). Use 'list' first to discover server names. Server names are from mcp.json configuration.

serverName.description: Server name (from mcp.json). Required for start/stop/restart.

languageModelTools.name: qopilot_mcp_output
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Read output from an MCP server's log channel. Useful for diagnosing server startup failures or runtime errors. Use 'list' action first to see available servers, then 'read' with a server name to get its output.

action.description: Action: 'list' shows servers, 'read' gets log content, 'show' opens the output panel

serverName.description: Server name to read logs from

lines.description: Number of recent lines to return (default: 50)
